trans-unit.source: Closes all resources associated with a process previously run with STDIO redirection.

seg-source.mrk: Closes all resources associated with a process previously run with STDIO redirection.

target.mrk: Closes all resources associated with a process previously run with STDIO redirection.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The process ID of a child process, as returned by a previous call to Run.

seg-source.mrk: The process ID of a child process, as returned by a previous call to Run.

target.mrk: The process ID of a child process, as returned by a previous call to Run.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Non-zero.

target.mrk: Non-zero.

trans-unit.source: 0 if the process did not have STDIO redirection or was already closed.

seg-source.mrk: 0 if the process did not have STDIO redirection or was already closed.

target.mrk: 0 if the process did not have STDIO redirection or was already closed.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function closes all handles and releases all resources related to STDIO. It will no longer be possible to read the STDIO data from the process. Any pending data will be lost.

seg-source.mrk: This function closes all handles and releases all resources related to STDIO.
It will no longer be possible to read the STDIO data from the process.
Any pending data will be lost.

target.mrk: This function closes all handles and releases all resources related to STDIO.
It will no longer be possible to read the STDIO data from the process.
Any pending data will be lost.

trans-unit.source: Close the Stdio stream of the PID returned by Run. This will cause the message box to display due to not being able to read the stdout stream.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Stdio stream of the PID returned by Run.
This will cause the message box to display due to not being able to read the stdout stream.

target.mrk: Close the Stdio stream of the PID returned by Run.

trans-unit.source: Use StringSplit to split the output of StdoutRead to an array. All carriage returns (@CRLF) are stripped and @CRLF (line feed) is used as the delimiter.
